    • Constructor Detail

      • TSP

        public TSP(java.util.Scanner inFile)
        Constructor that initializes the instance variables. Here we read the inFile one line at a time, parsing the input and adding the first line to the cities, and each subsequent line to the distanceTable. The minimumDistance is set to a arbitrarily large number so that the initial comparison later will be automatically smaller. Note that we also index the file as the cities are being added so we can invert/recurse on this later
        Parameters:
        inFile - the data file with cities and distances to be read

    • Method Detail

      • getMinDistance

        public int getMinDistance()
        Method to return the distance of the optimal permutation
        Returns:
        minimumDistance the optimal distance for the given cities

      • solveTSP

        public java.lang.String solveTSP(java.io.PrintWriter outFile)
        Method to solve the traveling salesman problem for the given data set. Note that this version of a solution riffs on the word permutations example from the text (chapter 8) using ints instead of strings. We create a private method to actually perform the necessary operations, we just set it up here
        Parameters:
        outFile -
        Returns:
        string with the optimal ordering of cities

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> A,
                        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> B)
        Method to convert to a string. Used to translate the optimal permutation to a list of corresponding cities
        Parameters:
        A - ArrayList of strings to be filled
        B - ArrayList of integers to be added
        Returns:
        string of strings
